text: The 1948 Summer Olympics, officially known as the Games of the XIV Olympiad, were held at London in the United Kingdom.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "1948 London Summer Games" ; retrieved 2012-7-23. These were the first Summer Olympics to be held since the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin, because no Games were held during World War II. In part, the games were thought to be a success because the Organizing Committee did not go into debt. The final financial report showed a â‚¤29,000 profit.Zarnowski, C. Frank. "A Look at Olympic Costs," Citius, Altius, Fortius (US). Summer 1992, Vol. 1, Issue 1, p. 22 [7 of 14 PDF]; retrieved 2012-7-24. == Participating nations == A total of 59 nations sent athletes to compete at the London Games.Taking part in the games for the first time were British Guiana (now Guyana), Burma (now Myanmar), Ceylon (now Sri Lanka), Iran, Iraq, Jamaica, Korea, Lebanon, Pakistan, Puerto Rico, Singapore, Syria, Trinidad and Tobago, and Venezuela. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References == ==Other websites== * IOC page for the 1948 Summer Olympics Category:1948 Summer Olympics Category:1948 in sports Category:1940s in England Category:20th century in London
title: 1948 Summer Olympics
